messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Re: diapers - totally OT
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 5/2/2002 1:30:15 PM Eastern Daylight Time, ... The *point* is, diaper-making-companies get to double the profits!!!! Kate Davis [Non-text
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 5/2/2002 1:30:15 PM Eastern Daylight Time,
dacunefare@... writes:


> The disposable "training pants" are just diapers in disguise. What's the
> point of them, anyway? No kid I know would mistake them for real underwear.
>

The *point* is, diaper-making-companies get to double the profits!!!!

Kate Davis


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Re: diapers - totally OT
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 5/2/02 11:30:24 AM, dacunefare@aol.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 5/2/02 11:30:24 AM, dacunefare@... writes:

<< The disposable "training pants" are just diapers in disguise. What's the
point of them, anyway? No kid I know would mistake them for real underwear. >>

The point is that they can pull them down, pee, and put them back on, which
they can't do with diapers with tape.

At that point when the kids usually or sometimes can get to the potty on
their own, they're disposables which can be operated by kids.

Sandra

messages.subject: Re: diapers - totally OT
messages.msgSnippet: **I was reading your post and wondered if the women in the church removed the training pants as if it was underwear?   LOL My girlfriend did it that way and it
messages.messageBody:
**I was reading your post and wondered if the women in
the church removed the training pants as if it was
underwear? LOL My girlfriend did it that way and it
smeared everywhere. I had to explain to her that your
supose to rip them on the side like you would diapers!**

We used *real* training pants - like thick cotton underwear. You sure as heck
don't go ripping those down the sides! :-)

The disposable "training pants" are just diapers in disguise. What's the
point of them, anyway? No kid I know would mistake them for real underwear.

Deborah in IL
